metadata.title: CVE-2017-17857 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The check_stack_boundary function in kernel/bpf/verifier.c in the Linuxkernel through 4.14.8 allows local users to cause a denial of service(memory corruption) or possibly have unspecified other impact by leveragingmishandling of invalid variable stack read operations.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-17857` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-24-generic - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-24-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-24-lowlatency - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-24-generic - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-24-lowlatency - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1013-azure - 4.15.0-1013.13~16.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1014-gcp - 4.15.0-1014.14~16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1013.13~16.04.2').
linux-gcp package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1014.14~16.04.1').
linux-euclid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
